metadata.synopsis: A lower city denizen visits the Guildhall to do business there, she needs to meet a courier that will smuggle gold for her.

1.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
1.text: Ah, you did not see me. A peer of the Parliament openly walking the Guildhall would sell a few copies of Baldur's Mouth, I expect.
1.context: NodeContext: Nervous - a politician politely worried they've been recognised in a den of thieves.

2.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
2.text: I'm sure my colleagues in Parliament will be happy to work with the Zhentarim. Nine-Fingers was, of course, a blight on our fair city.
2.context: NodeContext: Nervous - you're trying to paper over the fact that you're a political hostage.

3.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
3.text: The guildmaster wishes to keep me close. A representative from her friends in Parliament, during this time of upheaval.
3.context: NodeContext: Nervous - you're trying to paper over the fact that you're a political hostage.

4.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
4.text: You seem to know these Zhentarim. You might... put in a good word?
4.context: NodeContext: Nervous amusement - there's just been a bloody coup attempt in the Guildhall, to which you were a neutral party

5.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
5.text: Watching gods - Parliament has nothing on the power struggles down here.
5.context: NodeContext: Nervous amusement - there's just been a bloody coup attempt in the Guildhall, to which you were a neutral party

6.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
6.text: It's well for everyone that Nine-Fingers prevailed. Parliament has spent years cultivating our... necessary friendship.
6.context: NodeContext: Nervous relief - you're a politician, and the crime boss who has you in her pocket just won a bloody power struggle

7.speaker: Carnelia Vanthampur
7.text: Parliament stands ready to work with the next guildmaster. If that... is you?
7.context: NodeContext: Nervously feeling us out - there's just been a bloody power struggle, and we're the only ones still standing.
